flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=266>>266 games.
1/2 of these games means 1/2 * 266 games = <<1/2*266=313>>313 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 313 games * $7/game = $<<313*7=2191>>2191 on them.
The other -47 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him -47 games * $3/game = $<<-47*3=-141>>-141.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $2191 + $-141 = $<<960+2191+-141=3010>>3010.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 133, not 313. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
